org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.layouting

Class FRLayouter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.layouting.FRLayouter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Operator, UnaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphOperator<LogicalGraph>, UnaryBaseGraphToValueOperator<LogicalGraph,LogicalGraph>, UnaryGraphToGraphOperator, LayoutingAlgorithm
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CentroidFRLayouter, FusingFRLayouter, SamplingFRLayouter

    public class FRLayouter
extends Object
implements LayoutingAlgorithm
    Layouts a graph using the Fruchtermann-Reingold algorithm

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static double DEFAULT_K
      Default value for parameter k.
      protected int height
      User supplied height of the layouting-space

      Number of iterations to perform

      User supplied k.

      User supplied maximum distance for computing repulsion-forces between vertices
      protected int numberOfVertices
      (Estimated) number of vertices in the graph.
      protected boolean useExistingLayout
      If true, do not create a random initial layout but use the existing layout of the graph instead.
      protected int width
      User supplied width of the layouting-space

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_K

        protected static final double DEFAULT_K
        Default value for parameter k. All other default-values are derived from that.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • iterations

        protected int iterations
        Number of iterations to perform

      • k

        protected double k
        User supplied k. Main-parameter of the FR-Algorithm. Optimum distance between connected vertices.

      • width

        protected int width
        User supplied width of the layouting-space

      • height

        protected int height
        User supplied height of the layouting-space

      • maxRepulsionDistance

        protected int maxRepulsionDistance
        User supplied maximum distance for computing repulsion-forces between vertices

      • numberOfVertices

        protected int numberOfVertices
        (Estimated) number of vertices in the graph. Needed to calculate default parameters

      • useExistingLayout

        protected boolean useExistingLayout
        If true, do not create a random initial layout but use the existing layout of the graph instead.

    • Method Detail

      • k

        public FRLayouter k(double k)
        Override default k-parameter of the FR-Algorithm Default: 100
        Parameters:
        k - new k
        Returns:
        this (for method-chaining)

      • area

        public FRLayouter area(int width,
                       int height)
        Override default layout-space size Default: width = height = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(k, 2) * numberOfVertices) * 0.5
        Parameters:
        width - new width
        height - new height
        Returns:
        this (for method-chaining)

      • maxRepulsionDistance

        public FRLayouter maxRepulsionDistance(int maxRepulsionDistance)
        Override default maxRepulsionDistance of the FR-Algorithm. Vertices with larger distance are ignored in repulsion-force calculation Default-Value is relative to current k. If k is overridden, this is changed accordingly automatically. Default: 2k
        Parameters:
        maxRepulsionDistance - new value
        Returns:
        this (for method-chaining)

      • useExistingLayout

        public FRLayouter useExistingLayout(boolean uel)
        Use the existing layout as starting point instead of creating a random one. If used, EVERY vertex in the input-graph MUST have an X and Y property!
        Parameters:
        uel - whether to re-use the existing layout or not
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)

      • startAtIteration

        public FRLayouter startAtIteration(int startAtIteration)
        Perform the layouting as if this number of iterations had already passed
        Parameters:
        startAtIteration - the number of previous iterations
        Returns:
        this (for method-chaining)

      • execute

        public LogicalGraph execute(LogicalGraph g)
        Description copied from interface: LayoutingAlgorithm
        Layouts the given graph. After layouting all vertices will have two new properties: X: the assigned x-coordinate
        Y: the assigned y-coordinate
        Specified by:
        execute in interface UnaryBaseGraphToValueOperator<LogicalGraph,LogicalGraph>
        Specified by:
        execute in interface LayoutingAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        g - The graph to layout
        Returns:
        The input-graph, but every vertex now has X and Y coordinates as properties

      • createInitialLayout

        protected LogicalGraph createInitialLayout(LogicalGraph g)
        Creates a layout as the starting-point for the algorithm. If useExistingLayout is false, the created layout is random, else it is the already existing layout of the graph.
        Parameters:
        g - The graph to layout
        Returns:
        The randomly layouted input graph

      • layout

        protected void layout(LGraph g)
        Perform the actual layouting (calculate and apply forces)
        Parameters:
        g - The Graph to layout. It is modified by this method.

      • applyForces

        protected org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LVertex> applyForces(org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LVertex> vertices,
                                                                 org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<Force> forces,
                                                                 int iterations)
        Applies the given forces to the given vertices.
        Parameters:
        vertices - Vertices to move
        forces - Forces to apply. At most one per vertex. The id indicates which vertex the force should be applied to
        iterations - Number of iterations that will be performed (NOT the number of the current iteration). It is used to compute the simulated annealing shedule.
        Returns:
        The input vertices with x and y coordinated changed according to the given force and current iteration number.

      • repulsionForces

        protected org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<Force> repulsionForces(org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LVertex> vertices)
        Calculates the repulsive forces between the given vertices.
        Parameters:
        vertices - A dataset of vertices
        Returns:
        Dataset of applied forces. May (and will) contain multiple forces for each vertex.

      • attractionForces

        protected org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<Force> attractionForces(org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LVertex> vertices,
                                                                    org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LEdge> edges)
        Compute the attractive-forces between all vertices connected by edges.
        Parameters:
        vertices - The vertices
        edges - The edges between vertices
        Returns:
        A mapping from VertexId to x and y forces
